<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 193, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 246, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 437, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 291, 539, 321]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 337, 228, 352]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>{{label}} There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 368, 905, 400]]<|/det|>
For each question there are four possible answers \(\mathbf{A}\) , \(\mathbf{B}\) , \(\mathbf{C}\) and \(\mathbf{D}\) . Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 400, 578, 415]]<|/det|>
Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 415, 275, 430]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 431, 868, 462]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 462, 330, 476]]<|/det|>
Do not use correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 477, 364, 492]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 492, 329, 507]]<|/det|>
You may use a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 507, 670, 523]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 565, 391, 580]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 40.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 581, 806, 597]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 597, 571, 613]]<|/det|>
Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

The diagram shows a stand. The stand holds a heavy mass above the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 510, 655, 530]]<|/det|>
Which two changes would definitely make the stand more stable?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 540, 133, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 540, 532, 559]]<|/det|>
Lower the mass and make the base narrower.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 567, 131, 585]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 567, 504, 585]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 594, 129, 612]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 594, 527, 612]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 620, 131, 638]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 620, 504, 638]]<|/det|>
Raise the mass and make the base wider.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 664, 96, 682]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 664, 707, 682]]<|/det|>
Two wind farms supply electrical energy to consumers in different ways.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 694, 920, 727]]<|/det|>
Wind farm 1 supplies energy directly to consumers and for every 1000 J of energy extracted from the wind, 360 J is transferred to consumers as electrical energy.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 739, 920, 788]]<|/det|>
Wind farm 2 stores electrical energy in batteries and then supplies energy from the batteries to the consumer. For every 1000 J of energy extracted from the wind, 270 J is transferred to consumers as electrical energy.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 800, 559, 817]]<|/det|>
Which statement about the two wind farms is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 827, 131, 845]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 827, 667, 845]]<|/det|>
Wind farm 1 is less reliable and less efficient than wind farm 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 854, 131, 871]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 854, 670, 871]]<|/det|>
Wind farm 1 is less reliable but more efficient than wind farm 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 880, 131, 898]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 880, 670, 898]]<|/det|>
Wind farm 1 is more reliable but less efficient than wind farm 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 907, 131, 925]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 907, 685, 925]]<|/det|>
Wind farm 1 is more reliable and more efficient than wind farm 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>13</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A man who weighs \(540 \text{N}\) stands with both feet on the ground. The area of contact between one foot and the ground is \(0.015 \text{m}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 116, 561, 135]]<|/det|>
What is the pressure exerted on the floor by the man?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 145, 144, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 145, 245, 163]]<|/det|>
\(1800 \text{N} /\text{m}^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 170, 144, 189]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 170, 245, 189]]<|/det|>
\(3600 \text{N} /\text{m}^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 197, 138, 215]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 197, 260, 215]]<|/det|>
\(18000 \text{N} /\text{m}^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 222, 138, 241]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 222, 260, 240]]<|/det|>
\(36 000 \text{N} /\text{m}^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 268, 106, 286]]<|/det|>
<label>14</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 267, 920, 301]]<|/det|>
On a warm day, a driver checks the air pressure in a car tyre. At night, the temperature drops and the air pressure in the tyre decreases. There are no air leaks in the tyre.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 312, 401, 331]]<|/det|>
Why does the pressure decrease?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 339, 134, 358]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 339, 546, 358]]<|/det|>
The air molecules in the tyre move more slowly.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 365, 133, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 365, 499, 384]]<|/det|>
The air molecules in the tyre stop moving.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 392, 133, 411]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 392, 512, 411]]<|/det|>
The volume of the air in the tyre decreases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 419, 133, 437]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 419, 504, 437]]<|/det|>
The volume of the air in the tyre increases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 463, 106, 482]]<|/det|>
<label>15</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 463, 761, 482]]<|/det|>
Wet clothes are put out on a line to allow the water in the clothes to evaporate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 494, 720, 512]]<|/det|>
Which type of weather would cause the water to evaporate most quickly?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 522, 133, 541]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 522, 346, 541]]<|/det|>
a cold day with no wind

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 549, 133, 567]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 549, 322, 567]]<|/det|>
a cold day with wind

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 575, 133, 593]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 575, 339, 593]]<|/det|>
a hot day with no wind

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 600, 133, 619]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 600, 312, 619]]<|/det|>
a hot day with wind

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|> A bimetallic strip is used to control the temperature of electrical appliances. It is made of two different metals fixed together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 116, 747, 134]]<|/det|> The diagram shows the shape of the bimetallic strip before and after heating. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[237, 144, 759, 250]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 262, 348, 279]]<|/det|> Which statement is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 291, 136, 307]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 291, 554, 307]]<|/det|> Metal P contracts more than metal Q on heating. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 317, 134, 333]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 317, 552, 333]]<|/det|> Metal Q contracts more than metal P on heating. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 343, 134, 361]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 343, 549, 359]]<|/det|> Metal P expands more than metal Q on heating. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 368, 134, 386]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 368, 549, 384]]<|/det|> Metal Q expands more than metal P on heating. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 413, 106, 431]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 413, 920, 460]]<|/det|> Samples of four different substances are heated in turn by the same heater, for the same time duration and in the same conditions. The increase in temperature for each sample is recorded in the table. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 473, 520, 491]]<|/det|> Which sample has the highest thermal capacity? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 501, 490, 648]]<|/det|>
sampletemperature rise/°C
Aaluminium6.0
Bcopper8.0
Cmercury10.0
Dwater5.0
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 675, 106, 692]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 675, 831, 692]]<|/det|> Thermal energy is supplied at the same rate to four bars made from different materials. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[321, 700, 675, 739]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 752, 826, 768]]<|/det|> After several minutes, there is a temperature difference between X and Y for each bar. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 782, 920, 814]]<|/det|> Which statement identifies the bar with the greatest temperature difference between points X and Y, and gives the correct reason? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 826, 134, 844]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 826, 618, 843]]<|/det|> copper because it is a good conductor of thermal energy <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 852, 134, 870]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 852, 450, 870]]<|/det|> lead because it is the densest metal <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 879, 134, 897]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 879, 608, 896]]<|/det|> plastic because it is a poor conductor of thermal energy <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 905, 134, 922]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 905, 606, 922]]<|/det|> wood because it is a good conductor of thermal energy

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 473, 133, 491]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 473, 208, 491]]<|/det|> X only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 473, 298, 491]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[303, 473, 390, 491]]<|/det|> X and Y <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 473, 468, 491]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 473, 543, 491]]<|/det|> X and Z <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[613, 473, 633, 491]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[648, 473, 707, 491]]<|/det|> Z only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 518, 106, 536]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 517, 579, 536]]<|/det|> Which statement is correct for the nucleus of any atom? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 106, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>39</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 668, 92]]<|/det|>
Three types of radiation are \(\alpha\) -radiation, \(\beta\) -radiation and \(\gamma\) -radiation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 102, 348, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 131, 134, 149]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 131, 507, 150]]<|/det|>
\(\alpha\) -radiation is less ionising than \(\beta\) -radiation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 159, 133, 178]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 159, 507, 178]]<|/det|>
